content:
That sounds like a great plan! Dedicating a few hours each week to learning is a great way to make progress without feeling overwhelmed. And it's excellent that you're thinking about applying what you learn to your work and daily life. Reflection is a crucial step in the learning process, and it will help you to retain information better and make meaningful changes.

RescueTime and Todoist are both excellent tools for time management, and they can help you stay focused and on track. The Pomodoro Technique is also a great way to boost your productivity and reduce distractions.

Remember, the key is to be consistent and flexible. Don't be too hard on yourself if you miss a week or two, but instead, focus on getting back on track as soon as possible. And don't hesitate to reach out if you need any more recommendations or advice.

You've got this! You're taking the first steps towards upskilling and reskilling, and that's something to be proud of. Keep me updated on your progress, and I'll be happy to provide any further guidance or support.

Good luck on your learning journey!
